FILE: cm365740v11.0.txt
DYAD: RUSSIA/USSR-JAPAN
RIVALRY: RIV11014
DISPUTE(S): MID227 MID2721 MID106 MID16 MID131 MID180 MID197 MID2606 MID1177 MID2702 MID510 MID2722 MID3260 MID178 MID2995 MID182 MID2724 MID2994 MID409 MID2993 MID184 MID258 MID183 MID3207 MID2847 MID2852 MID2861 MID253 MID2873 MID1799 MID2882 MID2888 MID2893 MID2903 MID2911 MID2930 MID2925 MID2937 MID2726 MID365 MID2964 MID2727 MID2976 MID2229 MID2728 MID4042 MID4297 MID4222 MID4239 

PS: 19009999-20209999 0.00

PS-UPDATE2020: Frequent disputes through 2014 and unresolved territorial claims makes this a continuing rivalry. Under Prime Minister Abe, Japan makes some initiatives to Russia, but these are not reciprocated and the island disputes remains salient with no prospect of a friendship treaty. See https://carnegiemoscow.org/commentary/85574 and https://csis-website-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/s3fs-public/180402_Strategic_Japan_Yoko_Hirose_paper.pdf?hyrXAqS45pW4vaKWsrE7ZNbqvbfICkwN

PS1800: 18610313-18999999 0.0

PSNOTES: 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220305
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220305

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

Pre-1900 MIDs: MID227 MID2721 MID106 MID16 MID131 

WWI MIDs: MID197 MID2606 

WWII MIDs: MID258 

MID180 

TERRMID: MID180 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID180 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID180 from Gibler 2018, this is the Russo-Japanese War in the early 20th century. Russia and Japan had claims in Manchuria and Korea. Russia began to push further into Korea, angering Japan. Japan demanded that Russia evacuate Manchuria and later declared war on Russia. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to territorial disputes in Manchuria and Japan. 

TERRLINK: MID180 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID180 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID180 the Russo-Japanese War also involved a territorial dispute between Russia and Korea, outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID180 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID180 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID180 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID180 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID180 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID180 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID180 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID180 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID180 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID180 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID180 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID180 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1177 

TERRMID: MID1177 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1177 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1177 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1177 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1177 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1177 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1177 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1177 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1177 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1177 3 -- uncertain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1177 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, rebels in Siberia attacked a Japanese unit that was part of the Allied intervention in the Russian Civil War. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to the Russian Civil War, and coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped. Russia was cooperating with Japan in this incident, and they should therefore not be on opposite sides in this MID.

TERRLINK-CER: MID2702 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2702 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2702 3 -- uncertain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2702 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, Japan seized a Russian vessel in 2016. Coded not maritime because this was not connected to a maritime dispute, and coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped since there is insufficient historical information on this MID.

CIVWARMID: MID510 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID510 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID510 from cm narrative, MID510 occurred from April of 1920 until October of 1922. Japanese forces land at Vladivostok, beginning Allied intervention in Siberia and eastern Russia. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to the Russian Civil War.

ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2722 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2722 3 -- uncertain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2722 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, this MID is likely connected to MID510, but it has insufficient historical information. It seems to be connected to the Japanese intervention in the Russian Civil War. Coded uncertain because GML recommend the case be drooped due to lack of historical information.

COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3260 

TERRMID: MID3260 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3260 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3260 from Gibler 2018, MID3260 occurred in January of 1926. This bilateral dispute is coded as a threat to use force by Japan. Russia, Japan, and China each had claims on parts of Manchuria. The Soviets dominated in Manchuria for a long time, but as Japan grew in strength, tensions increased. Here, China was also attempting to gain greater control in Manchuria and Chinese soldiers often disrupted Soviet interests there via banditry. The Soviets issued a threat to China, and Japan responded with a threat to USSR to protect its holdings in Manchuria. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute in Manchuria. 

TERRLINK: MID3260 1 -- third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3260 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3260 China also had claims to Manchuria at the time, and its territorial interests triggered this MID.

MARITMID: MID3260 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3260 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3260 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3260 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3260 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3260 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3260 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3260 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID3260 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3260 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3260 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID178 

TERRMID: MID178 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID178 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID178 from Gibler 2018, Japan took over Manchuria and established a puppet state, threatening Russian railroad interests and prompting a Russian build up of troops on the border. Minor clashes occurred. Japan eventually negotiated a transfer of the railway to Japan. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute in Manchuria between Japan and USSR.

TERRLINK-CER: MID178 1 -- certain

MID2995 

TERRMID: MID2995 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2995 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2995 from Gibler 2018, Japan detained two Soviet soldiers that crossed into Japanese territory in Manchuria. They later decided the men were political escapees and released them without returning them to USSR. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute in Manchuria, and Japan captured the Soviets because they believed they were military personnel in the disputed area.

MID182 

TERRMID: MID182 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID182 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID182 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID182 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID182 from Gibler 2018, Japan was still pursuing colonial expansionism in Mongolia, and Mongolia was receiving support from the Soviets. In 1936-1936, Japan fought with Mongolian troops along the Mongolian border. Soviet Union is pulled into this MID due to its support of Mongolia. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute between Mongolia and Japan.

MARITMID-CER: MID182 1 -- certain

MID2724 

TERRMID: MID2724 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2724 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2724 from Gibler 2018, this is a series of border clashes along Japan and Russia's disputed Manchurian border. The countries agreed to set up a boundary commission to try to resolve the dispute. Coded territorial MID beause this was connected to a territorial dispute.

MID2994 

TERRMID: MID2994 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2994 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2994 from cm narrative, this MID is similar to MID2724. A series of border clashes along the disputed Manchurian border between Russia and Japan occurred. Coded terriorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute.

MID409 

TERRMID: MID409 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID409 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID409 from Gibler 2018, Japan and Russia disputed ownership of the Amur river, an inland river boundary. The Soviets harrassed Japanese vessels in the river and occupied islands in the disputed river. Japan occupied other islands, and the Soviets seized several Japanese vessels. Coded terriorial MID because this was connected to a dispute over an inland river boundary.

TERRLINK: MID409 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID409 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID409 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID409 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID409 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID409 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID409 from cm narrative, the islands in the disputed Amur River that the Soviets occupied were also disputed, so this MID has an islands dispute element as well.

CIVWARMID-CER: MID409 1 -- certain

MID2993 

TERRMID: MID2993 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2993 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2993 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2993 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2993 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2993 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2993 from cm narrative, MID2993 occurred 9/5-10/1937. This dispute was over fishing rights. The two states disputed the rights to fishing waters off the Siberian coast. The Soviets seized several Japanese fishing vessels. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime boundary dispute. 

ISLMID: MID2993 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID2993 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2993 from cm narrative, another incident in the dispute is the Japanese presence on North Sakhalin Island. Coded islands MID because this is connected to a dispte over islands in the disputed waters off Siberia.

MID184 

TERRMID: MID184 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID184 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID184 from Gibler 2018, USRSR and Japan disputed the area of Changkufeng, and this led to several clashes between the countries. In 1938, the Soviets fortified the border, and Japan attacked the fortifications. The Soviets constructed new positions and launched a counterattack. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute.

TERRLINK-CER: MID184 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MID3207 

TERRMID: MID3207 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3207 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3207 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3207 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3207 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3207 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3207 Per Huth and Allee 2002, the dispute over these islands involves disputed fishing rights. There is therefore a maritime boundary issue present here since the states dispute sovereignty over the islands because of their maritime boundary implications. See ISLMID-NOTES. 

ISLMID: MID3207 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID3207 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID3207 from cm narrative, MID3207 occurs from October 17, 1953 to June 20, 1954. This dispute has to do with the disputed islands north of Japan (the Habomai group, Shikotan, Kunashiri and Etorofu.) On October 19, the Soviets seized a fishing boat near Kunashir Island. Two other fishing boats were seized near the Kurile Islands. During this period over 100 Japanese fishing boats were seized by the Soviets in the coastal waters near these islands. Coded islands MID because this was connected to disputed islands. 

CIVWARMID: MID3207 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3207 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3207 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3207 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3207 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3207 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3207 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3207 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2847 

TERRMID: MID2847 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2847 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2847 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2847 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2847 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2847 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2847 from cm narrative, MID2847 occurred from March 24, 1955 until November 19, 1957. This dispute occurred during the Japanese-Soviet Peace Teaty Negotiations. Japanese and Soviet representatives held negotiations in London from June 1, 1955 to March 20, 1956. The Soviet Union announced restrictions of Japanese fishing vessels in Soviet territorial waters on March 21, 1956, but the countries signed the *Convention on Fishing in the Open Seas of the North-West Pacific* in Moscow on May 14, 1956. The parties held negotiations in Moscow from July 31, 1956 to August 13, 1956. Japanese and Soviet representatives signed an agreement in Moscow on September 29, 1956, which provided for the termination of the state of war between the countries. Japan and the Soviet Union formally ended the state of war and resumed diplomatic relations on December 12, 1956. During these negotiations the Soviets threatened the Japanese by establishing large bases in Sakhalin Island very close to Japanese territory. Coded not maritime because this was not connected to a maritime boundary dispute but rather to fishing rights. 

ISLMID: MID2847 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2847 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2847 The Soviets threatened to occupy Sakhalin Island during this dispute, but this island was not disputed.

CIVWARMID: MID2847 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2847 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2847 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2847 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2847 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2847 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2847 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2847 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2852 

TERRMID: MID2852 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2852 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2852 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2852 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2852 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2852 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2852 from cm narrative, MID2852 occurred from June 4-October 5, 1958. During this period the Soviets seized a number of Japanese fishing boats near disputed islands north of Japan. Coded maritime MID because the waters around the disputed islands were disputed. 

ISLMID: MID2852 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID2852 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2852 coded islands MID because this was connected to disputed islands. 

CIVWARMID: MID2852 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2852 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2852 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2852 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2852 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2852 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2852 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2852 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2861 

TERRMID: MID2861 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2861 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2861 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2861 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2861 1 -- maritime MID 
MARITMID-CER: MID2861 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2861 from cm narrative and Gibler 2018, in 1959 the Soviets began seizing all Japanese ships within 12 miles of its shore. Japan protested but the USSR kept seizing ships. From cm narrative, Japan and USSR had numerous disputed maritime areas connected to fishing rights at this time, and the waters in which the seizures occurred were disputed. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime boundary dispute. 

ISLMID: MID2861 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2861 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2861 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2861 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2861 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2861 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2861 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2861 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2861 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2861 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID253 

TERRMID: MID253 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID253 from Gibler 2018, in 1960 the Soviets downed a US recon plane and detained the 4 crew members. The Soviets protested US actions in Soviet airspace, attempted to pursue a solution through the UN, and were blocked from doing so. Japan is pulled into this MID because they supported the US and allowed the US to use their territory for bases from which to fly the recon flights. Coded not territory because this was not connected to a territorial dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID253 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID253 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID253 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID253 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID253 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID253 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID253 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2873 

TERRMID: MID2873 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2873 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2873 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2873 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2873 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2873 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2873 coded maritime MID because, per cm narrative and Gibler 2018, the islands were disputed because of maritime boundary implications. See ISLMID-NOTES. 

ISLMID: MID2873 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID2873 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2873 from Gibler 2018, in 1960 the Soviets seized Japanese fishing vessels that approached disputed islands that the Soviets had occupied since WWII but that Japan also claimed. Japan protested. Coded islands MID because this was connected to sovereignty over disputed islands. 

CIVWARMID: MID2873 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2873 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2873 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2873 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2873 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2873 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2873 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2873 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1799 

TERRMID: MID1799 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1799 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1799 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1799 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1799 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1799 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID1799 from Gibler 2018, Japan and USSR reached an agreement on where fishermen from each country could fish, but Japanese fishermen continued fishing in Soviet waters. Many fishing vessels were seized by SU. Japan protested extended detention periods. Coded not maritime because this was not connected to a maritime bondary dispute. 

ISLMID: MID1799 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1799 1 -- certain

MID2882 

TERRMID: MID2882 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2882 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2882 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2882 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2882 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2882 3 -- uncertain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2882 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, the Soviets seized several Japanese fishing vessels in 1961. This occurred in the disputed waters near Hokkaido. Seizures of vessels were common in these waters as part of the maritime dispute. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime boundary dispute, but coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped since Japan did not protest. 

ISLMID: MID2882 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2882 1 -- certain

MARITMID: MID2888 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2888 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2888 from Gibler 2018, the Soviets seized many Japanese fishing boats in 1962. Japan protested. Per cm narrative, the seizures occurred in disputed waters near the Hokkaido islands. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime boundary dispute.

MARITMID: MID2893 3 -- not maritime

MARITMID-NOTES: MID2893 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, USSR seized a Japanese fishing vessel illegally fishing in Soviet waters. Coded not maritime because this was not connected to a maritime boundary dispute, and coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped since Japan did not protest.

MARITMID-NOTES: MID2903 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, USSR seized Japanese fishing vessels that were fishing in disputed waters. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime boundary dispute, but coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped since Japan did not protest.

Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime boundary dispute, but coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped since Japan did not protest. 

ISLMID: MID2911 3 -- not islands

MID2930 

TERRMID: MID2930 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2930 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2930 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2930 from cm narrative, occurred in May of 1967. The US was conducting naval exercises with Japan and South Korea within a few hundred miles of Soviet territory. USSR ships and warplanes responded by conducting simultaneous exercises, and Soviet ships got so close to US warships that collisions occurred. Coded not maritime because although this was a naval flare-up, this was not connected to a maritime dispute between Japan and SU. Thes were military excercises and connected to Cold War tensions. 

ISLMID: MID2930 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2930 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2930 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2930 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2930 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2925 

TERRMID: MID2925 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2925 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2925 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2925 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2925 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2925 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2925 from cm narrative, MID2925 occurred from September 28, 1968 until November 8, 1968. This is a dispute over access to fishing waters. The Japanese fish the waters near the Kurile Islands heavily. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime boundary dispute. 

ISLMID: MID2925 3 -- not islands
ISLMID-CER: MID2925 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2925 the waters involved in this dispute are off the coast of disputed islands, but the islands themselves are not the center of this MID; only the disputed waters are. 

CIVWARMID: MID2925 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2925 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2925 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2925 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID2925 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2925 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2925 1 -- certain

MID2937 

TERRMID: MID2937 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2937 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2937 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2937 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2937 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2937 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2937 from Gibler 2018, a Soviet vessel rammed a Japanese fishing vessel in disputed waters and accused it of violating USSR maritime borders. Japan anounced its intentions to fortify a port near the disputed waters to protect its fishing vessels. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime boundary dispute. 

ISLMID: MID2937 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2937 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2937 the disputed waters were off the coast of disputed islands, but the islands themselves were not the center of this dispute. 

CIVWARMID: MID2937 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2937 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2937 3 -- not civil war link

COUPLINK-CER: MID2937 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2726 

TERRMID: MID2726 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2726 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2726 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2726 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2726 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2726 3 -- uncertain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2726 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, the Soviets engaged in military exercises in 1975. Coded not maritime because although USSR and Japan were disputing a maritime boundary, this was not connected to a boundary dispute. Coded uncertain because GML recommend the case be dropped since no country was the target of the exercises. 

ISLMID: MID2726 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2726 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

MID365 

TERRMID: MID365 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID365 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID365 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID365 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID365 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID365 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID365 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID365 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID365 from Gibler 2018, a Soviet pilot landed on Hokkaido island and sought to defect to the USA. Japan, which had a base on the island, dismantled the plane to the objection of the Soviets. The pilot was eventually granted asylum in the US. Coded not islands because this island was not disputed. This was connected to Cold War tensions, not to a boundary/sovereignty dispute. 

CIVWARMID: MID365 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID365 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID365 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID365 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID365 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID365 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID365 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID365 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2964 

TERRMID: MID2964 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2964 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2964 from Gibler 2018, Soviet bombers violated Japanese airspace in 1977. Japan scrambled fighter planes in response. Coded not territory beacuse this was not connected to a boundary dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID2964 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2964 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2727 

TERRMID: MID2727 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2727 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2727 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2727 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2727 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2727 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2727 per cm narrative, the islands involved in this MID, the disputed Kurile islands, are disputed due to maritime boundary implications. Also, some of the military maneuvers that constitute this MID occur in the disputed waters. 

ISLMID: MID2727 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID2727 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2727 from Gibler 2018, the Soviets began military maneuvers on and around an island disputed by USSR and Japan, and Japan protested. Coded islands MID because this was connected to an islands dispute. 

CIVWARMID: MID2727 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2727 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2727 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2727 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2727 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2727 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2727 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2727 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2976 

TERRMID: MID2976 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2976 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2976 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2976 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2976 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2976 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2976 from Gibler 2018, Japan intercepted a Soviet Union transport plane that violated Japanese airspace while returning from Vietnam. Although Japan and USSR had maritime disputes in connection to disputed islands, per New York Times 4/4/1982, this incident occurred over the island of Kyushu, which was not disputed. Coded not maritime because this was not connected to a maritime boundary dispute. 

ISLMID: MID2976 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2976 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2976 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2976 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2976 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2976 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2976 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2976 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2976 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2976 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2229 

TERRMID: MID2229 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2229 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2229 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2229 from cm narrative, the Kurile Islands are disputed due to maritime boundary implications, making this also a maritime MID. See ISLMID-NOTES. 

ISLMID: MID2229 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2229 this is a multilateral MID involving US and Japan vs. USSR. Japan and USSR disputed sovereignty over the Kurile Islands (Elleman, Nichols, and Ouimet 1998). From cm narrative, this MID is known as the "Militarization of Kuril Islands." This MID involves a show of planes between US and USSR and a public US commitment to deploy 50 planes to Honshu, a Japanese island, by 1985. USSR protested but took no action. Japan also deployed planes to the disputed island. Coded islands MID because this was connected to an islands dispute. 

CIVWARMID: MID2229 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2229 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2229 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2229 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES:

MID2728 

TERRMID: MID2728 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2728 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2728 from Gibler 2018, Soviet planes violated Japanese airspace, and Japan scarmbled jets in response. Japan formally protested the violation of their airspace. Coded not territory because this was not connected to a boundary dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID2728 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2728 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2728 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2728 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2728 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2728 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2728 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2728 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2728 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2728 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2728 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2728 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2728 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2728 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4042 

TERRMID: MID4042 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4042 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4042 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4042 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4042 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4042 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4042 from Gibler 2018, Russia seized Japanese fishing vessels in disputed waters near disputed islands. The Soviets also violated Japanese airspace and Japan scrambled jets in response. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to disputed waters. 

ISLMID: MID4042 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4042 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4042 the islands near the waters were also disputed, but the islands themselves were not connected to this dispute. 

CIVWARMID: MID4042 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4042 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4042 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4042 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4042 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4042 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4042 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4042 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4297 

TERRMID: MID4297 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4297 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4297 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4297 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4297 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4297 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4297 from Gibler 2018, Russia seized several Japanese trawlers in disputed waters, and Japan protested. The countries later agreed to try and resolve the maritime boundary dispute. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime boundary dispute. 

ISLMID: MID4297 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4297 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4297 from Gibler 2018, while most events in this MID occur in and in connection to disputed waters, this MID also involves diplomats discussing a disputed island near the waters that has maritime boundary implications. The officials discussed settling the disputed islands issue to prevent future maritime incidents. Coded not islands MID because the island dispute does not give rise to or feature in the events of the MID (for similar effect, see MID4222). 

CIVWARMID: MID4297 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4297 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4297 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4297 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4297 3 -- not coup

COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4222 

TERRMID: MID4222 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4222 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4222 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4222 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4222 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4222 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4222 from cm narrative, a Russian coast guard vessel fired at, and subsequently seized a Japanese fishing trawler on April 21, 2000 in the region of the disputed southern Kurile islands. The Japanese authorities indicated that the Japanese fishermen had never left the 200mile Japanese economic zone. However, the Russian officials legitimized the firing and seizure of the Russian coast guards, saying that the Japanese vessel disobeyed orders from a Russian patrol boat to stop for inspection. According to them, the Japanese vessel entered the Russian economic zone and was seized by the Russian border guards while it was escaping from the Russian economic zone into the neutral waters. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime boundary dispute. 

ISLMID: MID4222 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4222 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4222 although the events of this mid occur in the region of a disputed island, the island itself does not feature in or motivate them. 

CIVWARMID: MID4222 3 -- not civil war

MID183 

TERRMID: MID183 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID183 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID183 1 -- third party link to territorial MID 
TERRLINK-CER: MID183 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID183 from Gibler 2018, the border between Mongolia and Japan-controlled territory in China was undefined. In 1939, a war broke out over the disputed territory. The Soviets supported the Mongol forces against the Japanese with military assistance, pulling them into this MID against Japan. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to a disputed border between Mongolia and Japan, outside this dyad.
